trip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose
return trip (=when you are travelling back to where you started)
trip.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
It’s an 80-mile round trip (=a journey to a place and back again) to Exeter.
I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (=a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose), Mr Burgess has already left.
He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
a boat trip up the Thames
We’re thinking of taking a trip to the mountains.
Did you enjoy your trip to Disneyland?
The Palace is only a short trip from here.
trip.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the strange mental experiences someone has when they take a drug such as LSD
trip.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a person or experience that is amusing and unusual
trip.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: an act of falling as a result of hitting something with your foot
trip.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: accidents caused by trips or falls
trip.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I’ve been on a coach trip to France.
Take a trip on the Santa Fe railway or cruise on a Mississippi paddle boat.
I couldn’t see him making the long trip to Minneapolis alone.
I’m on a business trip with my boss.
He was knocked off his bicycle on his way home from a shopping trip.
She went on a school trip to Tuscany.
They took a boat trip to see the seals.
Take a day trip to York, which is just 15 miles away.
His wife makes a hundred and fifty mile round trip to see him twice a week.
A day or two later she began her return trip to Chicago.
I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip. We don’t have those shoes in stock.
trip.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: You go on a trip somewhere
We went on a trip to Morocco
trip.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: You go for a walk somewhere
Miranda went for a long walk on the beach
trip.translation[0].note_box[1].items[2]: You go for a drive somewhere
We went for a drive in the mountains
trip.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: a visit to a place that involves a journey, done for pleasure, business, shopping etc
The trip to the coast took longer than we expected.
Did you have a good trip?
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially a long distance
a long train journey
We continued our journey on foot.
They made the journey across the plains in a covered wagon.
the general activity of travelling, especially over long distances for pleasure. Don’t confuse travel and trip
a special ticket for train travel around Europe
Foreign travel is becoming increasingly popular.
travels
trips to places that are far away
She told us about her travels in South America.
different types of trip
tour
a trip for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc
She’s on a three week tour of Europe.
excursion
a short trip to visit a place on holiday, usually by a group of people
You can go on an afternoon excursion to Catalina Island.
expedition
a long and carefully organized trip, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place
Lewis and Clark’s expedition across North America
Scott led an expedition to the South Pole.
commute
a trip to or from work that someone does every day
How long is your daily commute?
crossing
a trip by boat from one piece of land to another
The Atlantic crossing was rough and stormy.
cruise
a trip by boat for pleasure
We went on a cruise around the Caribbean.
voyage
a very long trip in which you travel by ship or in a spacecraft
Columbus set out on his voyage across the ocean.
trek
a long and difficult trip on foot, in a place far from towns and cities
They did a trek across the Atlas Mountains.
pilgrimage
a trip to a holy place for religious reasons
She went on a pilgrimage to Lourdes.
trip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall
trip.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Clary tripped over a cable and broke his foot.
He tripped on the bottom step.
trip.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make someone fall by putting your foot in front of them when they are moving
trip.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Baggio was tripped inside the penalty area.
trip.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to switch on a piece of electrical equipment by accident
trip.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: An intruder had tripped the alarm.
trip.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to walk, run, or dance with quick light steps
trip.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: a little girl tripping down the lane
trip.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to experience the mental effects of a drug such as LSD
